metadata.title: Configuration - CDK for Terraform
metadata.description: Use the cdktf.json file to customize configuration settings and define the providers and modules to use with your application.

CDKTF generates these code bindings from `,mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"p"},`cdktf.json`),` when you run `,mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"p"},`cdktf get`),`. We have a selection of pre-built `,mdx("a",{parentName:"p","href":"/terraform/cdktf/concepts/providers#install-pre-built-providers"},`providers`),` available, but you may occasionally want to re-generate the code bindings for those providers yourself. For example, you may need a different version of that provider than the pre-built package. We do not provide pre-built modules, so you must always declare them in your `,mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"p"},`cdktf.json`),` file.`),mdx("p",null,`The `,mdx("a",{parentName:"p","href":"/terraform/language/providers/requirements#source-addresses"},`schema`),` for both providers and modules in CDK for Terraform consists of a name, a `,mdx("a",{parentName:"p","href":"/terraform/language/providers/requirements#source-addresses"},`source`),`, and a `,mdx("a",{parentName:"p","href":"/terraform/language/providers/requirements#version-constraints"},`version constraint`),`.`),mdx("p",null,`You can declare providers and modules using either JSON or a string with the format `,mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"p"},`source@ ~> version`),`.`),mdx("h3",{"id":"provider-source"},mdx("a",{parentName:"h3","className":"__permalink-h","href":"#provider-source","aria-label":"provider source permalink"},`\xbb`),`Provider Source`),mdx("ul",null,mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},mdx("p",{parentName:"li"},mdx("strong",{parentName:"p"},`HashiCorp providers`),`: You can specify official HashiCorp `,mdx("a",{parentName:"p","href":"https://registry.terraform.io/browse/providers?tier=official"},`maintained providers`),` by their name on the Terraform Registry. For example, you can use `,mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"p"},`aws`),` to declare the official `,mdx("a",{parentName:"p","href":"https://registry.terraform.io/providers/hashicorp/aws/latest"},`AWS provider`),`: `,mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"p"},`aws@ ~> 2.0`))),mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},mdx("p",{parentName:"li"},mdx("strong",{parentName:"p"},`Community providers`),`: You must provide the fully-qualified name. The fully-qualified name is available on the provider's registry page. For example, to define the `,mdx("a",{parentName:"p","href":"https://registry.terraform.io/providers/DataDog/datadog/latest"},`DataDog provider`),`: `,mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"p"},`DataDog/datadog@ ~> 3.4.0`)))),mdx("h3",{"id":"module-source"},mdx("a",{parentName:"h3","className":"__permalink-h","href":"#module-source","aria-label":"module source permalink"},`\xbb`),`Module Source`),mdx("ul",null,mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},mdx("p",{parentName:"li"},`For modules on the Terraform Registry, provide the the full registry namespace. For example, to define the `,mdx("a",{parentName:"p","href":"https://registry.terraform.io/modules/terraform-aws-modules/vpc/aws/latest"},`AWS VPC module`),`: `,mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"p"},`terraform-aws-modules/vpc/aws@ ~> 3.2.0`),`.`)),mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},mdx("p",{parentName:"li"},`For local modules, please use the object format to ensure that CDKTF can properly name the generated classes.`),mdx("pre",{parentName:"li","className":"language-jsonc"},mdx("code",{parentName:"pre","className":"language-jsonc"},`{`,`
